text: The Huey P. Long - O.K. Allen Bridge is a truss cantilever bridge. It goes over the Mississippi River. US 190 travels on the bridge, as well as a rail line. It helps people go between East Baton Rouge Parish, Louisiana and West Baton Rouge Parish, Louisiana. The bridge is named after former Louisiana governors Huey P. Long and Oscar K. Allen. People in Baton Rogue call the bridge "the old bridge"."Paint Party". The Riverside Reader. [Port Allen, LA] October 1, 2012. Pg. 1. Print ==References== Category:Bridges in the United States Category:Baton Rouge, Louisiana
title: Huey P. Long Bridge (Baton Rouge)
